alert.note: Alert for Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 9:56AM CST until January 29 at 11:00AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... San Jacinto River near Sheldon affecting Harris County. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Porter, Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Humble, Sheldon...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Jacinto River near Sheldon. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CST Sunday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM CST Sunday was 13.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 3.9 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.3 feet on 05/15/1982. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed San Jacinto River Sheldon 10.0 11.3 Sun 9 am CST 9.2 7.3 5.7 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening. late tonight at 400 AM CST.
